title: Sampler, 1809
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: satin, cross, back, stem, four-sided, chain, eyelet, running, and wrapped cross stitches; withdrawn element work with needle lace fillings
inscribed: (Translated, the original is in Spanish):" Made by Belinda Fernandez a student of Maria Sanchez Badiho in 1809, Long live Jesus Mary and Joseph"
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Detached motifs in a central square with radiating borders.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1809.
1809. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: satin, cross, back, stem, four-sided, chain, eyelet, running, and wrapped cross stitches; withdrawn element work with needle lace fillings. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-211.
